conclusion: Understanding how shadow position and size change when light source moves backward.
Shadow position will move forward as light source moves backward.
Shadow size is inversely proportional to distance from light source, so it will become smaller as light source moves backward.
Shadow A is cast by the sandal.
Shadow A will move forward and become smaller as light source moves backward.
Shadow B is cast by the black box.
Shadow B will move forward and become smaller as light source moves backward.
Shadow C is cast by the cake.
Shadow C will move forward and become smaller as light source moves backward.
Shadow D is cast by the black object on the right.
Shadow D will move forward and become smaller as light source moves backward.
Effect of moving the light source backward: shadows move forward and decrease in size.
Final answer: all shadows (A, B, C, D) will move forward and become smaller.
